reviews.review: Yet again bhvr is doing something that ruins the game and also the environment. What a combo! It feels like they are trying to one up themselves. I know that there are good people at bhvr but holy shit does the bad out weight the good. Whoever is running the show is really trying his / her best to make the game unplayable and suck all the goodwill out of the players by supporting nfts. I thought i would never see the day this game would support nfts but i guess its a new low for them. I would say boycott the game but it seems that it just doesnt even matter anymore. What i will say is please play VHS or Propnight. We need to actively show bhvr that this is unacceptable and that other games will overtake them.

I think BHVR forgot other regions than NA and EU exists. These people don't really care much if you're not from that region. Games in SEA server are generally shit and unfun. I can only manage to have fun when I'm in a swf with friends. Will not recommend this game if you're mostly playing alone and not from NA or EU, because trust me, you're either going to get lobby sim experience, or severely outranked...

Named as The Labor of Love Award 2019!
Pretty good job SO FAR! XD

I've been following since before release, have it on XBox and PC. Play on Xbox a lot more, friends are there.
Game USED to be a ton of fun. However, with them bringing in new characters, the Killers seems to get more and more overpowered and basically you just can't win against them unless they literally have 2 braincells.

Like the Pig is undetectable when crouching and then sprints faster that the victims.
Kruger is undetectable then you hear music for a split second and BAM, asleep and he sees you everywhere with limited ways to wake up.
Myers just has basically no terror radius and can 1 hit victims after like 4 min in the game.

Just so many killers make is essentially unplayable since you cant ban or avoid certain Killers to have a sort of enjoyable game.

I just wish they could balance this game because I really do love the idea for this game.
Used to be great with like 1-2 Friends, running around screaming and having panic attacks from dodging and getting away from the killers.
This game revolves around mostly knowledge so it takes a lot of time to get good but its fun. Lots of toxic players so lots of fun trash talk post game.
Jogo muito bom de verdade, muito bom para jogar com os amigos, vale a pena
Juegazo para jugar especialmente con amigos, aunque para hacer puntos de sangre extra conviene jugar solo y como asesino. A mi me entretiene muchÃ­simo.

Great game and tons of fun with friends!

Everyone knows what Dead by Daylight is so, I am not going to waste your time talking about what the game is. I do want to talk about the "Port" to the PC. LAZY is the word for it. It's locked to 60 Fps, for some that's fine but, If you are running on a monitor with a high refresh rate like 100HZ or 144Hz it will feel sluggish. 

There are pretty much NO graphic options so, if you have trouble running the game tough sh*t lol, there isn't anything you can do besides adjust the resolution scaling & change the graphics quality from Low, Med, High & Ultra. 

I can't recommend this game cause of the port it's quite annoying I can't support devs that think it's okay to just take the sh*t console version & throw it on the PC with the mentality "It will run, sell it." & that's what I see here. It's a pass for me.
The game is really exciting and at times scary,i recommend people to get this game.Also don't be toxicccc :))))))
I don't think the devs have ever cared about this game or the community OR the content creators...

Always nerve racking as a survivor. Love the tension of trying to escape. Haven't gotten a chance to play as a killer yet but just from the survivor side love this game.

If you think CS:GO toxic, try this game.

This is simultaneously the most fun, and most infuriating game I've played in a long time.

It's an asymmetrical game where one player is a powerful killer, hunting down 4 elusive survivors before they can start generators and leave the trial.

For an asymmetrical game, it's in a state where it's surprisingly balanced between the two sides. Either side has a few things that infuriate the other and certain killers are notoriously overpowered, or underpowered. Freddy Kreuger mains, for instance, must hate themselves to play that, and Nurse mains must just hate playing the game fairly.

New content is regular, 1 killer, 1 survivor, 3 perks for each side, and a map are released every 3 months or so, mid chapter balance patches occur, and cosmetics are regularly added. Recent content additions have, however, cut back on content. A new map hasn't been added with the last 2 additions, each of which only contained 1 character. They have also dropped the term "paragraph" which used to refer to 1 character being added and now refer to all DLC as "chapters," meaning their roadmap now suddenly promises a lot less future content. They are also reworking an old tileset to have "5 different configurations" changing the layout but using the same buildings, meaning much less variation than original tilesets that have 5 completely unique maps built on them.

Recent killer additions have been mediocre at best. The Legion (Dec 2018) was released and completely changed the chase dynamics for the killer, which was blatantly broken and had very little counterplay. They were soon nerfed into a state where they barely feel like they have a power any more. Since then, the Plague (Mar 2019) and the Ghost Face (June 2019) have powers that are overwhelmingly controlled by the survivor players more than the killer, making them incredibly frustrating and unrewarding to play. Due to their mistakes with Legion they seem scared to release killers that actually feel decent in the meta. Only one "strong" killer has been added in the last 2 years.

There are downsides however. While balance patches come regularly, they won't do anything incremental. Freddy is ridiculously weak, but they refuse to give him small quality of life changes that they have said he needs until they are ready to release a full rework of him. Meaning rather than sitting at a 'meh' stage, he sits in boring, weak and generally unfun. His upcoming rework has finally been announced in (some) detail, which, going off the most recent version we've heard, leaves a lot to be desired.

Pay to pay to keep paying. Buying the game will net you around one third of the cast. Many are also available through grinding, however licensed killers and survivors require further payment. Their perks are also locked to you, unless they are picked on the "random" weekly shrine. (The good ones rarely are.) On top of this, despite in game currency being used for cosmetics, anything they think looks good or will be popular is locked behind payment only. It's a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ move when you may have already spent upwards of $80 just to unlock characters.

Awesome, and incredibly angry, community, as you'd expect from a game like this.
